result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas Edward Kinyon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Thomas Edward Kinyon is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Thomas Edward Kinyon was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Payable at the rate of $50.00 per month, starting January 1, 2016 and on the same day thereafter, until paid in full.    Failure to pay any part of the fine or court costs in full by the due date will result in 1 day jail for each $25 left unpaid.
May apply for expungment after 1 year if he successfully completes this sentence.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas Edward Kinyon

defendant.name: Kinyon, Thomas Edward
defendant.address: 309 W Madison St, Black River Fall, WI 54615

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: DA Gerald Fox appears for the State. Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Poss.  Plead no contest to Count 1.  Count 2 dismissed.  Court recited the charge and possible penalties of the charge he plead to.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  Defendant understood.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the plea.  Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently entered his plea and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty of count 1.  Joint recommendation for a fine.  State recommended a fine in the amount of $300.00, plus costs.  Defense asks for $100 fine, plus costs.  Court ordered: $300, plus costs and DNA surcharge.  $50.00 per month starting 1/1/16.    Failure to pay any part of the fine or court costs in full by the due date will result in 1 day jail for each $25 left unpaid.
ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with ATtorney Poss.  Set for plea/sentencing on 11/30 at 1:30 pm

Pre-trial conference at 10-21-2015 10:00 am.
Status conference at 11-09-2015 03:00 pm.

ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Paul Fredrickson for Attorney Poss.  Waive reading of complaint.  Mute.  NGP entered   PTC 10/21 & STC 11/9/   Bond continued.
Per GJ - he was given a copy of the complaint and the pink booking she to report to JASO.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.

Defendant appeared without counsel.  Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  He states he has received a copy of the complaint.  Court reviews charges and potential penalties.  He states he understands and he will talk to an attorney.  Court explained his attorney options.  Court states the complaint is missing the ATN#.  $500 signature bond set with conditions and he must report to Jackson County Jail to be booked.  Set for adjourned initial appearance on 9-28-15 at 9:30.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.
